page.title: 15BYFORD CHURCH
page.content: BYFORD CHURCH People living on Byford Common attend Byford church. There is a priest in charge based at Weobly helped by a retired clergyman at Staunton on Wye. 3 services a month are held with congregation averaging 20 with up to 80 at Festivals. Due to the shortage of clergy, villagers sometimes take services. The church has just been rewired and a new heating system installed at a cost of Â£2800, the money raised by local efforts and sale of surplus church silver. recent gifts to the church include churchwardens' staves, a carpet runner, flower pedestal and oak table. Affection for the church is such that old parishoners often bring their children and grandchildren back for baptism.
